title.narrative: Strengthening three economic initiatives led by women, in order to build local economic network.

description.narrative: As a continuation of the project ESL172, this project is a second phase called "Identifying associative entrepreneurship groups led by women to achieve their economic autonomy." The project aims to improve economic productive activities, acquiring and developing capacities for collective construction of knowledge and organization that will lead to integrated economic and human development. The project focus is to strengthen organisational processes and promote sustainable agriculture through the implementation of alternative practices in the agricultural production system. The project will promote the use native seeds to increase yields and productivity. The project will ensure the full involvement of women and young people, strengthening their voice and leadership. In general, this initiative seeks to improve the socio-economic conditions of rural communities in the municipalities of Guaymango, Jujutla and San Antonio del Monte. ASS-CVX will strengthen the economic and financial autonomy of women with training focused on managing their own finances and starting their own businesses, using the principles of Solidarity Economy – this focuses on building a just and sustainable world. The aim is to identify and meet the needs of the community that aren’t being met by the government due to a focus on profit, leading to negligence of the needs of local people and the planet. We will re-enforce the importance of a dignified life, not to accumulate wealth but to learn from the process, leading to material and spiritual benefit. The target group will be trained on themes such as the legal framework, gender and masculinity roles, and inequality. Gender and women’s empowerment will be essential to the reflection and promotion of the project activities. This project aims to contribute to the improvement of living conditions and quality of life for women in the poorest and most excluded communities of El Salvador by strengthening their ability to earn a living. The project will achieve this through managing a business environment based on a solidary economy, including increased self-esteem, equality, and economic empowerment. The communities will also learn to better manage the environment, including natural resources and farming practices, and increasing resilience to the negative impacts and shocks of climate change and changing weather patterns.
